title: Sogeking is Actually Usopp Theory
theory: Despite Sogeking claiming to be from Sniper Island and being a separate person, many fans theorize that Sogeking is actually Usopp in disguise. Evidence includes: identical voice, same fighting style and weapons, appearing right after Usopp refused to help, and the fact that Sogeking's mask looks similar to Usopp's goggles.
author: One Piece Fandom (Collective)
communityReception: This is actually a running gag in the One Piece community where fans playfully insist Sogeking and Usopp are different people, maintaining the joke from the series where Luffy and Chopper genuinely don't recognize Usopp.

title: Sniper Island is Usopp's Heart Theory
theory: Some fans theorize that 'Sniper Island' that Sogeking claims to be from doesn't exist as a physical location, but rather represents Usopp's courage and determination - it exists in his heart. This theory suggests that Usopp created the Sogeking persona as a manifestation of the brave warrior he wants to become.
author: Various One Piece Fans
communityReception: This theory is widely accepted in the community and is supported by Sogeking's theme song lyrics which state 'Sniper Island is in your heart.' It represents Usopp's journey toward becoming a brave warrior of the sea.

title: Luffy and Chopper Can't Recognize Sogeking Because of Their Innocence
theory: While most of the crew (and viewers) immediately recognize that Sogeking is Usopp, Luffy and Chopper genuinely cannot tell. Some fans theorize this isn't just for comedic effect - it reflects Luffy and Chopper's pure, innocent nature. They take things at face value and don't overthink, so if someone says they're a different person, they believe it. This also shows their respect for Usopp's need to maintain his pride.
author: One Piece Community Discussion
communityReception: This theory is popular and makes sense given Luffy and Chopper's established characters. It adds depth to what could be seen as just a comedy gag.

title: The 300 Pound Cannon Math Error Was Intentional Character Development
theory: Some fans theorize that Luffy's 'mistake' in rounding 216 to 300 instead of 200 wasn't just for comedy - it shows that Luffy always aims higher than expected. He doesn't round down or settle for less; he rounds up, symbolizing his tendency to exceed expectations and push beyond normal limits.
author: One Piece Analysis Community
communityReception: This is a more interpretive theory that some fans appreciate as adding thematic depth to what appears to be a simple comedy moment.

title: Wanze's Ramen Kenpo Foreshadows Food-Based Devil Fruits
theory: Some fans speculated that Wanze's bizarre Ramen Kenpo fighting style could be foreshadowing for food-based Devil Fruits in the One Piece world. While Wanze doesn't have a Devil Fruit, his ability to create and manipulate ramen in combat led some to theorize that food-based Paramecia fruits might exist.
author: One Piece Theorists
communityReception: This theory was popular when the episode first aired. Later revelations of various Paramecia abilities showed that food-manipulation abilities do exist in One Piece (like Smoothie's powers), though not quite in the way Wanze demonstrates.
